body: While we are on the subject - using checkAccess for both checking if a user belongs to a role and whether they have permission to do some task is confusing at least.
Should I implement or will you?
If you have time, it would be great if you'll do it. I'm back from vacation and there's endless list of unread issues :)

issue.title: AuthAssignment Backwards incompatibility (Yii 2 to Yii 1.1)

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

There's no way to change the primarykey name on Auth\DbManager
### What do you get instead?

Hardcode user_id instead overridable placeholder.
### Rationale

I've got a huge application on Yii1 to be migrated to Yii2. That is a lot of work to be done at once, so I'm migrating progressively, and both Applications must be functional at the same time.

Auth\DbManager should not have hardcoded primary key column (_user_id_) that prevents me to reuse the Database structure of the legacy application (primary key _userid_ --- no underscore)
### What I propose.

Implement primaryKey() or $primaryKey on Auth\DbManager, so it could be easily overriden by extension or configuration.

body: Closing this since the only point that needs to be discussed is the name of the interface and that can be done in the PR.
we usually keep issues open until pr is merged.
